page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Dalmally also has within its boundaries, Kilchurn Castle. The comprises a series of buildings ranging from the middle of the fifteenth century to the end of the seventeenth century. The first of the buildings is a five storeyed tower house which was built by Sir Colin Campbell first of Glenorchy who died in 1475. There are several other items of historical interest in the area such as, monuments, bridges and the remains of villages and settlements. In nearby Loch Awe there is evidence of very early settlements built on the Loch, these are known as crannogs it is possible when the water level is low to see the tops of these settlements from the shore.
